title: The difference between the CP and SP of an article is Rs. 240. If the profit is 20%, what is the selling price? - Quora

response.answer_text: As per question, [(SP-CP)/CP]*100%= 20% => (SP-CP)/CP= 0.2 => SP-CP=0.2CP …….…….(i) Also, given: SP-CP=240………………(ii) Now combining both (i) and (ii), we get: 0.2CP=240 => CP=240/0.2 =>CP = 1200 Replacing CP=1200 in (ii),we get SP= 240+CP=240+1200= 1440/- Hope this helps!

As there is a profit, we know that SP > CP. Now, SP - CP = 240 Profit = 240 Profit % = 20 Profit % = (SP - CP) / CP 20 / 100 = 240 / CP CP = 240 x 100 / 20 CP = 1200 Therefore, SP = 240 + CP SP = 240 + 1200 SP = 1440
